case.summary: This was a motion brought by the accused for a stay. The accused argued the Crown had violated his right to a fair trial without delay under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms, 1982. A trial in the matter had been set, but had to be adjourned due to a mistake made by the Crown. The delay was over eleven months. HELD: The motion was allowed. The charges were stayed. The delay that resulted from the Crown's mistake was unreasonable.
